paper_title: Going Deeper into Locally Differentially Private Graph Neural Networks

hypotheses.hypothesis_text: Learning utility under local differential privacy in graph neural networks is affected by the feature dimension.
hypotheses.epistemic_justification: The abstract identifies feature dimension as a key factor influencing utility in privacy-preserving graph learning, implying a relationship between feature dimension and utility.
variables_identified: learning utility under LDP (e.g., node classification accuracy)
hypotheses.notes: Testable claim that feature dimension influences utility under LDP.

hypotheses.hypothesis_text: Neighborhood size affects learning utility under LDP in graph neural networks.
hypotheses.epistemic_justification: The abstract identifies neighborhood size as a factor influencing utility in privacy-preserving graph learning.
hypotheses.notes: Testable claim that neighborhood size influences utility under LDP.

hypotheses.hypothesis_text: In UPGNET, the High-Order Aggregator (HOA) layer improves learning utility under local differential privacy compared to a baseline without HOA.
hypotheses.epistemic_justification: HOA is introduced to enhance utility under LDP; its inclusion is expected to cause higher utility.
hypotheses.predicted_direction: HOA layer increases learning utility under LDP
hypotheses.specific_type_details: Comparison between HOA-enabled and HOA-disabled variants within UPGNET on the same task
hypotheses.notes: Direct test of HOA contribution to utility.

hypotheses.hypothesis_text: In UPGNET, the Node Feature Regularization (NFR) layer improves learning utility under local differential privacy compared to a baseline without NFR.
hypotheses.epistemic_justification: NFR is designed to regularize features to improve privacy-utility trade-off; expected to increase utility.
hypotheses.specific_type_details: Comparison between NFR-enabled and NFR-disabled variants within UPGNET
hypotheses.notes: Direct test of NFR contribution to utility.

hypotheses.hypothesis_text: The combination of HOA and NFR layers yields higher learning utility and privacy protection than existing methods.
hypotheses.epistemic_justification: The combined design is expected to improve both utility and privacy protection relative to current methods.
hypotheses.predicted_direction: HOA+NFR outperform existing methods in utility and privacy protection
hypotheses.specific_type_details: Empirical comparison against baselines on the same tasks
hypotheses.notes: Tests the synergy of the two proposed layers against existing approaches.

hypotheses.hypothesis_text: UPGNET significantly outperforms existing methods in terms of privacy protection and learning utility on real-world datasets.
hypotheses.epistemic_justification: The proposed method yields better privacy and utility in experiments.
hypotheses.specific_type_details: Empirical performance comparison on real-world datasets
hypotheses.notes: Direct claim of superior performance across datasets.

hypotheses.hypothesis_text: The three-stage UPGNET pipeline generalizes the local differential privacy protocols for node features in privacy-sensitive scenarios.
hypotheses.epistemic_justification: The pipeline is designed to generalize LDP protocols to node features; claims generalization capability.
hypotheses.specific_type_details: Generalization of LDP protocols to node features across privacy-sensitive scenarios

hypotheses.hypothesis_text: The HOA and NFR layers specifically mitigate the adverse effects of high feature dimension and large neighborhood size on learning utility under LDP.
hypotheses.epistemic_justification: The two proposed layers are designed to tackle the identified factors; their inclusion should improve utility when those factors are problematic.
hypotheses.predicted_direction: HOA and NFR improve utility as feature dimension or neighborhood size increase
hypotheses.specific_type_details: Mechanism-level claim linking design to mitigating factor-specific utility degradation
hypotheses.notes: Links the design to mitigation of identified utility-degrading factors.

hypotheses.hypothesis_text: UPGNET maintains strong privacy protection under local differential privacy guarantees while enabling higher learning utility than existing methods.
hypotheses.epistemic_justification: Claims about the privacy guarantees provided by the method alongside improved utility.
hypotheses.notes: Joint claim about preserving privacy while achieving higher utility.

processing_notes: Identified multiple explicit and implicit hypotheses from the abstract. Hypotheses cover (a) factors affecting utility under LDP (feature dimension, neighborhood size), (b) component contributions (HOA, NFR) to utility, (c) the combined method's comparative performance vs. baselines, (d) claimed generalization of the pipeline to node-feature LDP protocols, and (e) privacy guarantees alongside utility. Where directionality was not explicit in the text, non-directional predictions were assigned; where concrete comparative or causal claims were presented, directional and comparative-type predictions were used.
